content.question: Nucleotide base pairing in <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is universal across organisms. Each pair <math alttext="T and A; C and G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(T</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>A; C</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>G)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> consists of a purine and a pyrimidine. Which of the following best explains how the base pairs form?

choices.label: Ionic bonds join two double-ringed structures in each pair.
Hydrogen bonds join two single-ringed structures in each pair.
Hydrogen bonds join a double-ringed structure to a single-ringed structure in each pair.
Covalent bonds join a double-ringed structure to a single-ringed structure in each pair.

content.answer: Hydrogen bonds join a double-ringed structure to a single-ringed structure in each pair.
